item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#981)—Answers for Monday, February 16
item.content:encoded:
It’s time for a whole new week, and that means seven fresh NYT Connections challenges are waiting to be dominated. Hopefully, you can start as you mean to go on with a big win from today’s NYT Connections puzzle. That’s why I’m here, actually! I’m here to bring you the best NYT Connections hints and solutions for this challenge.

If you want the fastest and clearest tips for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, just read on.

How to Play NYT Connections

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words can have double meanings, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty, from least to most.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (February 16)

Here are the words from today’s NYT Connections puzzle:

  • BUCK
  • SCREAM
  • DO
  • LAUGH
  • FAWN
  • DOE
  • FLIGHT
  • SQUAWK
  • HOOT
  • FIGHT
  • RIOT
  • DOUGH
  • FREEZE
  • CACKLE
  • DOH
  • CLUCK

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Ways to describe something hilarious
  • Green – Sounds the same but spelled differently
  • Blue – What noises a chicken might make
  • Purple – How you respond to stress

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, February 16:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers Explained for Today, February 16 (#981)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – HOOT, LAUGH, RIOT, SCREAM
  • Green – DO, DOE, DOH, DOUGH
  • Blue – BUCK, CACKLE, CLUCK, SQUAWK
  • Purple – FAWN, FIGHT, FLIGHT, FREEZE

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

item.title: Today’s Strands #714 Hints and Answers for February 15, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Strands is a daily word search puzzle game from The New York Times. It is a relatively new game, launched in 2024, in which players seek a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid.

Whether it’s your first time playing or you’re a Strands veteran, today’s tips and strategies can help you find words faster. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Strands, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answers for Strands Game #714 for Sunday, February 15, 2026

To play today’s Strands, head to the game’s website.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of Strands. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Strands

Strands is a daily word search that challenges you to find words with a common theme. There’s also a Spanagram that reveals the deeper theme behind the words.

  • Words that are three letters and under do not count.
  • Words that reveal the correct theme appear in blue.
  • The Spanagram turns yellow when found.
  • Finding three words that don’t fit the theme will reveal a hint to help you find the proper words.

The goal is to string together as many words as possible. Every letter on the grid gets used! Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Strands can only be played on the New York Times website. You can also play on the NYT Games app.

Strands Hints For Today, February 15, 2026

The Strands’ answers for Game #714 are all aboutenlightenment. When you realize the theme is, “Now I get it!” You’ll have a good idea of what words to look for immediately. I was fortunate enough that I didn’t need any in-game hints. But if you need some hints,, just keep reading.

General Strands Hints For February 15

Without giving today’s Strands answers completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: Get out of the dark.
  • Hint 2: You are Patrick Star, telling Squidward how to hold an item.
  • Hint 3: When something finally clicks for you, you can say that you fully [this].

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Strands #714 for February 15, 2026.

Words to Help You Find Strand Hints for February 15, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Strands answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you unlock some in-game hints. A few starter words that may help are:

  • HOME
  • SEETHE
  • FLIGHT
  • FIGHT
  • PLIGHT
  • LIGHT

Today’s Strands Answer For Game #714 On February 15, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answers to today’s Strands below. Check out yesterday’s answers here.

  • GRASP
  • REALIZE
  • UNDERSTAND
  • FATHOM
  • APPREHEND
  • SPANAGRAM: SEETHELIGHT

If you solved today’s Strands without our answers, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

When Is The Next Strands Game After #714?

All New York Times games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before, giving players a heads-up. The game on February 16 will be Strands Game #715.

What Is Strands?

Strands is a daily word search puzzle game created by The New York Times. Launched in 2024, Strands challenges players to discover a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid. The game’s original concept was developed by Juliette Seive, a research director on The New York Times Games team, with the aim of replicating Wordle’s success. Tracy Bennett serves as the puzzle editor for Strands, overseeing the creation and curation of daily puzzles since its launch.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Fallout: The New West Reveal Trailer Posted With a Promise to Uncover ‘The Original Fallout 3’
item.content:encoded:
Fallout is a bustling realm that’s as much made up of the original projects by the developers as it is fan-made projects pieced together by those enthralled by the post-apocalyptic universe that emerged in the late 1990s. The latest entry into that world, Fallout: The New West, is no different, but it’s one of the more ambitious concepts to surface in recent years.

Fallout: The New West is a fan-made project that aims to remake the cancelled Fallout: Van Buren, which many die-hard fans have always dubbed ‘the original Fallout 3’. It’s what might have been had the original team not hit a patch of financial distress and shifted focus away from the series, ultimately selling the label to Bethesda Game Studios.

Fallout: The New West Revives What Might Have Been

Van Buren was canned in 2003 after months of development at Black Isle Studios. It would have been the third major release in the series, bearing the name ‘Fallout 3’ and taking players to the American southwest, around Colorado. Coincidentally, that’s where the next season of the Fallout television show is headed.

It was never to be, and in 2008, Bethesda Game Studios released Fallout 3, a monumental overhaul to the series and a real risk-taker of a game, after acquiring the licenses from Interplay and Black Isle.

Now, a group of dedicated modders is bringing Van Buren back to life with Fallout: The New West. It’s a complete conversion mod that promises to transform Fallout: New Vegas, telling the ‘same broad story envisioned by Fallout: Van Buren.’ On the website for Fallout: The New West, the game’s narrative was outlined, and by all accounts, it’s an ambitious stab at a near-forgotten game.

Days ago, The United West Team, the group assembling The New West, posted the first teaser trailer for the mod:

At the time of writing, the trailer had garnered more than 100,000 views and hundreds of positive comments. One user wrote, ‘For a moment, I thought this was from Bethesda and went, ‘Oh, so they were actually cooking.’ As always, it’s the community that keeps Fallout alive.’

Fallout: The New West actually surfaced around five years ago. In May 2021, the team at The United West announced plans to piece the mod together, but back then, it was dubbed Fallout Revelation Blue. Back then, it was noted that Fallout: The New West would not treat New Vegas as canonical.

One thing is for sure, and that’s that Bethesda’s Todd Howard probably won’t play this mod either, after effectively snubbing Fallout: London.

Are you excited to get your hands (digitally) on Fallout: The New West? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Layers of Fear 3 has been announced

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

item.title: Layers of Fear 3 Announced by Bloober Team
item.content:encoded:
Bloober Team officially reveals Layers of Fear 3, the next chapter in its psychological horror series.

Bloober Team previously teased a countdown clock that would expire on Valentine’s Day, featuring audio featuring a quote from The Sick Rose and a poem by William Blake.

The countdown clock was tied to the franchise’s 10th anniversary. It led to the reveal of Layers of Fear 3. The game’s tagline uses the same line from that poem heard in the audio, “Some things never leave the walls. They only learn to wait.”

History of the Layers of Fear Franchise

Layers of Fear is a psychological horror series centered around first-person exploration and puzzle-solving. Decision-making and branching narratives examine how the environment affects the main character.

The first game was originally released in 2016. The sequel was released in 2019. In 2023, an anthology remade both games. Now, it’s time for the next evolution of the franchise.

History of Bloober Team

Since 2010, Bloober has worked on over a dozen games. They also worked on the critically acclaimed 2024 remake of Silent Hill 2. They’re also remaking the original Silent Hill. The team is also developing a game called Project M exclusively for the Nintendo Switch family of consoles. Learn more about that here.

Insider Gaming will continue to provide the latest on Layers of Fear 3.

How excited are you for the third installment of the Layers of Fear franchise? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Six Invitational 2026 Grand Final — FaZe Clan and Team Secret For the $1 Million Prize
item.content:encoded:
The Six Invitational 2026 comes to a head tomorrow in Paris, and it’s all down to just two teams: FaZe Clan and Team Secret. Following an intense tournament, the grand finalists are lined up and raring to go, but only one will walk out of the stadium with $1 million and the coveted Six Invitational trophy.

It’s one of the most valuable grand finals in esports, as even the second-place team takes a $450,000 check home. Let’s jump into everything you need to know about the Six Invitational 2026 grand final.

Six Invitational 2026 Predictions: FaZe Clan vs. Team Secret

The Six Invitational is a tough one to call at this point. Even though only two teams remain, they’re very evenly matched as we run into the grand final. The group stage yielded similar results for both squads, with Team Secret having the edge, but FaZe Clan shone a little brighter during the playoffs.

It’s worth stressing that it’s FaZe Clan’s third grand final in a row at the Six Invitational, which is impressive by itself. Last year, the organization lifted the trophy in Boston after wiping Team BDS in the grand final, making up for a tough second-place finish on home turf in 2024.

Team Secret bloomed heavily last year, securing the win at the Esports World Cup, but FaZe Clan remains the favourite to lift the hammer this year in Paris. The community is behind FaZe Clan, but it’s close, and both teams are playing on neutral ground.

If you want to tune in, the grand final of the Six Invitational 2026 will start at 17:00 GMT, and you can expect some huge news from Ubisoft before it lands.

What are you thinking? Will we see an underdog upset from Team Secret, or will FaZe Clan go back-to-back at the Six Invitational? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that the Six Invitational 2027 is headed back to Brazil
